alert.note: Alert for Banner; Morrill; Scotts Bluff (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 5:46PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Scotts Bluff, western Morrill and northeastern Banner Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 446 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Minatare, or 7 miles east of Scottsbluff, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Scottsbluff, Gering, Bridgeport, Bayard, Minatare, Lake Minatare Campground, Chimney Rock State Park, Bridgeport State Recreation Area, Angora, Moomaws Corner, Scottsbluff Airport, Lake Minatare, Redington, The Intersection Of Highway 385 And L62, South Bayard Junction, Melbeta and McGrew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
